hopobject.name: symbian
hopobject.http_browser: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; en-US; rv:1.9.1.3) Gecko/20090824 Firefox/3.5.3
hopobject.body:
The Symbian platform is open source software based on Symbian OS, the most widely used open operating system for mobile phones. The OS has been integrated with software assets contributed by Nokia, NTT DOCOMO, and Sony Ericsson, including the S60 and MOAP(S) user interfaces.

Significant parts of the source code have already been moved to open source, under the Eclipse Public License. By mid-2010, this process will be complete.

Together, we will collaborate to create an industry standard, through open implementation, that will generate revenue for companies and choice for consumers.
hopobject.shortdesc: The Symbian platform is open source software based on Symbian OS, the most widely used open operating system for mobile phones. The OS has been integrated with software assets contributed by Nokia, NTT DOCOMO, and Sony Ericsson, including the S60 and MOAP(S) user interfaces.
